item.title: .NET App Developer Links - 2021-10-21
item.description: The latest news and resources for .NET app developers.

item.title: 136 facts every web dev should know before they burn out and turn to landscape painting or nude modelling
item.description: Everything I’ve learned about web development in the almost twenty-five years I’ve been practising. All boiled down into a neat little list that I put together over a week. I’m Icelandic, so I’m prone to absolute statements.
item.author: (Baldur Bjarnason)

item.title: Building and consuming GraphQL API in ASP.NET Core 5 - Simple Talk
item.description: GraphQL is a platform-independent, language-neutral query language and may be used to run queries and retrieve data. Joydip Kanjilal explains how to use GaphQI in an ASP.NET Core 5 app.
item.author: (Joydip Kanjilal)

item.title: A Tour Through the OWASP Top 10
item.description: OWASP has issued an update to its list of the top web app security threats. We'll look at the changes and how they impact your web applic...

item.title: Get started building a Progressive Web App!
item.description: Get started building a Progressive Web App! Hello fellow Web Developers! Today I want to talk about how you can use PWABuilder, an open-source project from Microsoft, Github, VSCode and Azure Static Web Apps to help you build a Progressive Web App (PWA) and then ship that PWA to both the Web AND app stores!
item.author: (Justin Willis)

item.title: Introducing Android™ Apps on Windows 11 to Windows Insiders
item.description: Windows is a platform for creators Windows is the most open platform on the planet for creators. Part of living our commitment to openness is welcoming partner technologies and content that deliver powerful experiences. And what makes Window
item.author: (Windows Insider Blog)

item.title: Building Your First UWP Application
item.description: What’s the deal with UWP? Universal Windows Platform is all about developing apps that are not only for Windows, but look, feel, and interact like they should be on Windows. Any device that runs Windows can run a UWP application, and UWP allows for integration and styling that really makes your application feel like it belongs on Windows.
item.author: (Zachary Teutsch)

item.title: Build ML powered experiences with Windows Machine Learning (WinML) and Intelligent APIs!
item.description: Hello, fellow developers! Today I want to talk to you about Windows Machine Learning (WinML). I’ll also talk about how you can use Intelligent APIs, an abstraction over WinML to build Machine Learning powered experiences in your applications on Windows with very few lines of code.
item.author: (Amrutha Srinivasan)

item.title: Leaking Value Objects from your Domain
item.description: Value Objects are domain concepts that are internal to a service boundary. Beware of leaking them by including them in Commands or Events.

item.title: Deploying PHP Applications to Azure App Service with Azure DevOps
item.description: This post is about deploying PHP applications to Azure App Service with Azure DevOps. Recently I had to deploy PHP application to Azure App Service. You can deploy it to Azure App Service using FTP, since there is no compilation steps required. If you’re using Composer - Dependency Manager for PHP, you need to run the composer install before deploying the files to app service via FTP. Instead of using deploying FTP deploy the app, I choose to implement a deployment pipeline, so that I don’t want to share the FTP credentials to the developer. And if I enable continuous integration - when ever developer commit some changes, can be deployed automatically to the app service.
item.author: (Anuraj)
